verses.verse: When a man<WH376> takes<WH3947> a wife,<WH802> and marries<WH1166> her,<WH4672> then it shall be, if she find no favor<WH2580> in his eyes,<WH5869> because he has found<WH4672> some<WH1697> unseemly<WH6172> thing in her,<WH3789> that he shall write her a bill<WH5612> of divorce,<WH3748> and give<WH5414> it in her hand,<WH3027> and send<WH7971> her out of his house.<WH1004>
When she is departed out<WH3318> of his house,<WH1004> she may go<WH1980> and be another<WH312> man<WH376>'s wife.

If the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> hate<WH8130> her,<WH3789> and write her a bill<WH5612> of divorce,<WH3748> and give<WH5414> it in her hand,<WH3027> and send<WH7971> her out of his house;<WH1004> or if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> die,<WH4191> who took<WH3947> her to be his wife;<WH802>

her former<WH7223> husband,<WH1167> who sent her away,<WH7971> may<WH3201> not take<WH3947> her again<WH7725> to be his wife,<WH802> after<WH310> that she is defiled;<WH2930> for that is abomination<WH8441> before<WH6440> Yahweh:<WH3068> and you shall not cause the land<WH776> to sin,<WH2398> which Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> gives<WH5414> you for an inheritance.<WH5159>

When a man<WH376> takes<WH3947> a new<WH2319> wife,<WH802> he shall not go out<WH3318> in the army,<WH6635> neither shall he be assigned<WH5674> any business:<WH1697> he shall be free<WH5355> at home<WH1004> one<WH259> year,<WH8141> and shall cheer<WH8055> his wife<WH802> whom he has taken.<WH3947>
No man shall take<WH2254> the mill<WH7347> or the upper millstone<WH7393> to pledge;<WH2254> for he takes<WH2254> a life<WH5315> in pledge.<WH2254>

If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> stealing<WH1589> any<WH5315> of his brothers<WH251> of the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> and he deal<WH6014> with him as a slave,<WH4376> or sell him;<WH1590> then that thief shall die:<WH4191> so you shall put<WH1197> away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from the midst of you.<WH7130>

Take heed<WH8104> in the plague<WH5061> of leprosy,<WH6883> that you observe<WH8104> diligently,<WH3966> and do<WH6213> according to all that the priests<WH3548> the Levites<WH3881> shall teach<WH3384> you:<WH6680> as I commanded them,<WH8104> so you shall observe to do.<WH6213>
Remember<WH2142> what Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> did<WH6213> to Miriam,<WH4813> by the way<WH1870> as you came forth<WH3318> out of Egypt.<WH4714>
When you do lend<WH5383> your neighbor<WH7453> any<WH3972> kind<WH4859> of loan,<WH935> you shall not go into his house<WH1004> to get<WH5670> his pledge.<WH5667>
You shall stand<WH5975> outside,<WH2351> and the man<WH376> to whom you do lend<WH5383> shall bring forth<WH3318> the pledge<WH5667> outside to you.<WH2351>
If he be a poor<WH6041> man,<WH376> you shall not sleep<WH7901> with his pledge;<WH5667>

you shall surely<WH7725> restore<WH7725> to him<WH7725> the pledge<WH5667> when the sun<WH8121> goes down,<WH935> that he may sleep<WH7901> in his garment,<WH8008> and bless<WH1288> you:<WH6666> and it shall be righteousness to you before<WH6440> Yahweh<WH3068> your God.<WH430>

You shall not oppress<WH6231> a hired servant<WH7916> who is poor<WH6041> and needy,<WH34> whether he be of your brothers,<WH251> or of your foreigners<WH1616> who are in your land<WH776> within your gates:<WH8179>

in his day<WH3117> you shall give<WH5414> him his hire,<WH7939> neither shall the sun<WH8121> go down<WH935> on it;<WH6041> for he is poor, and sets<WH5375> his heart<WH5315> on it:<WH7121> lest he cry against you to Yahweh,<WH3068> and it be sin to you.<WH2399>

The fathers<WH1> shall not be put to death<WH4191> for the children,<WH1121> neither shall the children<WH1121> be put to death<WH4191> for the fathers:<WH1> every man<WH376> shall be put to death<WH4191> for his own sin.<WH2399>
You shall not deprive<WH5186> the foreigner,<WH1616> or the fatherless<WH3490> of justice,<WH4941> nor take<WH2254> a widow<WH490>'s clothing<WH899> in pledge;<WH2254>

but you shall remember<WH2142> that you were a bondservant<WH5650> in Egypt,<WH4714> and Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> redeemed<WH6299> you there:<WH6680> therefore I command you to do<WH6213> this thing.<WH1697>

When you reap<WH7114> your harvest<WH7105> in your field,<WH7704> and have forgot<WH7911> a sheaf<WH6016> in the field,<WH7704> you shall not go again<WH7725> to get<WH3947> it:<WH1616> it shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless,<WH3490> and for the widow;<WH490> that Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> you in all the work<WH4639> of your hands.<WH3027>
When you beat<WH2251> your olive tree,<WH2132> you shall not go over the boughs<WH6286> again:<WH310> it shall be for the foreigner,<WH1616> for the fatherless,<WH3490> and for the widow.<WH490>
When you harvest<WH1219> your vineyard,<WH3754> you shall not glean<WH5953> it after<WH310> yourselves:<WH1616> it shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless,<WH3490> and for the widow.<WH490>
You shall remember<WH2142> that you were a bondservant<WH5650> in the land<WH776> of Egypt:<WH4714> therefore I command<WH6680> you to do<WH6213> this thing.<WH1697>
